intro: Galeopsis segetum, commonly known as field hedge-net, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and basil. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and have a distinctive blue or purple color. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in fields, where it thrives in full sun.
